author: AniVez
consequence: The Colosseum became an enduring symbol of Roman engineering, culture, and imperial power, influencing stadium architecture for centuries and cementing entertainment as a tool of governance.
description: The Colosseum, or Flavian Amphitheatre, was inaugurated under Emperor Titus. Capable of seating over 50,000 spectators, it hosted gladiator games, animal hunts, and public executions as a display of Roman might and entertainment.
prerequisite: The Flavian dynasty sought to restore Rome's prestige after Nero's reign and the Great Fire of 64 AD. Public morale and political legitimacy were bolstered through grand architectural projects.
title: Construction of the Colosseum

author: AniVez
consequence: China was divided into rival kingdoms, sparking decades of conflict and cultural evolution. It marked a shift from centralized control to regional warlordism.
description: The fall of the Han dynasty ended over four centuries of imperial rule, ushering in the chaotic Three Kingdoms period. Central authority collapsed, leading to fragmentation and civil war.
prerequisite: Long-term corruption in the imperial court, eunuch dominance, heavy taxation, land inequality, and large-scale uprisings such as the Yellow Turban Rebellion weakened the state.
title: Han Dynasty Decline

author: AniVez
consequence: The Islamic Golden Age followed, influencing science, philosophy, law, and architecture across Asia, Africa, and Europe. The religious and political map of the Middle East was permanently altered.
description: After Prophet Muhammad's death, his followers formed the Rashidun Caliphate, which rapidly expanded through military conquests and diplomacy, spreading Islam across vast territories.
prerequisite: Islam unified disparate Arab tribes under a single religious and political ideology, empowering them with a strong sense of mission and governance.
title: Rise of the Islamic Caliphate

author: AniVez
consequence: Sparked the rise of the Holy Roman Empire and solidified the medieval power structure of divine kingship, influencing European politics for centuries.
description: On Christmas Day, Pope Leo III crowned Charlemagne as Emperor of the Romans, reinforcing the alliance between the papacy and Western rulers.
prerequisite: Charlemagne's military conquests expanded Frankish influence and secured the Church's support through protection and religious reform.
title: Charlemagne Crowned Emperor

author: AniVez
consequence: The Norman Conquest introduced feudalism, French influence, and architectural transformation, laying the groundwork for the English monarchy and legal system.
description: William, Duke of Normandy, defeated Anglo-Saxon King Harold II at Hastings, becoming King of England and reshaping the country's future.
prerequisite: The death of Edward the Confessor without an heir led to competing claims and instability in England's succession.
title: Battle of Hastings

author: AniVez
consequence: Hungary and Poland suffered massive devastation, but the sudden death of the Great Khan led to Mongol withdrawal. The invasion left a legacy of fear and admiration across Europe.
description: The Mongols under Batu Khan defeated European forces at the Battle of Mohi, showcasing their unmatched mobility and tactical brilliance.
prerequisite: The Mongol Empire's rapid expansion under Genghis Khan and his successors aimed to conquer trade routes and consolidate power.
title: Mongol Invasion of Europe

author: AniVez
consequence: Galileo was placed under house arrest. The trial highlighted the conflict between science and religion, inspiring Enlightenment thinkers and the eventual secularization of science.
description: Galileo was tried by the Inquisition for supporting Copernicus' theory that the Earth orbits the Sun, a challenge to Church doctrine.
prerequisite: The Scientific Revolution, fueled by Renaissance inquiry and observation, clashed with the Catholic Church's geocentric views.
title: Galileo's Heliocentrism Trial

author: AniVez
consequence: The Tokugawa period ushered in peace, isolationist policies (sakoku), and cultural flourishing, including kabuki, haiku, and samurai code enforcement.
description: Tokugawa Ieyasu established a military government that ended centuries of civil war and centralized power in Edo (now Tokyo).
prerequisite: The end of the Sengoku (Warring States) period, where regional lords vied for dominance, left Japan exhausted and in need of unity.
title: Establishment of the Tokugawa Shogunate

author: AniVez
consequence: The Revolutionary War ensued, followed by the creation of the U.S. Constitution. The success inspired independence movements worldwide.
description: The Thirteen Colonies declared independence from British rule, asserting their right to self-governance and laying the foundation for a democratic republic.
prerequisite: Colonial frustration over taxation without representation, oppressive laws like the Stamp Act, and Enlightenment ideas of liberty and rights.
title: American Declaration of Independence

author: AniVez
consequence: Massive urban migration, labor reform, and global industrialization, which fueled colonialism and reshaped economies and societies.
description: A major transition to mechanized production began in Britain, revolutionizing industries such as textiles, steel, and transport.
prerequisite: Innovations like the spinning jenny, steam engine, and access to coal and capital enabled large-scale factory systems.
title: Industrial Revolution Begins in Britain

author: AniVez
consequence: Reunification of Germany, collapse of the Soviet Union in 1991, and the spread of liberal democracy across Eastern Europe.
description: Citizens of East and West Berlin tore down the wall separating them, symbolizing the end of communist rule in Eastern Europe.
prerequisite: Economic hardship in the Eastern Bloc, mass protests, and liberal reforms in the Soviet Union under Gorbachev.
title: Fall of the Berlin Wall

author: AniVez
consequence: The traumatic Partition with Pakistan led to widespread violence and displacement, but India emerged as the world's largest democracy.
description: After decades of peaceful protest and negotiation, India gained independence from British rule, ending over 200 years of colonization.
prerequisite: Nonviolent resistance led by Gandhi, World War II's impact on Britain, and rising global pressure to end colonialism.
title: India Gains Independence

author: AniVez
consequence: Several regimes fell, including in Egypt and Libya, but the region also faced civil wars, instability, and contested transitions to democracy.
description: Protests erupted after a street vendor's self-immolation, sparking nationwide demonstrations and eventually overthrowing the government.
prerequisite: Authoritarian regimes, economic stagnation, youth unemployment, and social media's power to mobilize dissent.
title: Arab Spring Begins

author: AniVez
consequence: Millions of deaths, mental health crises, economic slowdowns, accelerated digitization, and increased focus on public health infrastructure.
description: A novel coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) outbreak led to a global pandemic, drastically altering health systems, economies, and daily life.
prerequisite: High global travel, inadequate early containment, and zoonotic virus transmission from animals to humans.
title: COVID-19 Pandemic
